file_content.text: Still no medicine? My men are dying here! Hurry up!
Good job getting that medicine back. I don't know what would've happened if you hadn't.
Tell me you got that medicine. Nurse says one of the boys has gone into shock. He won't last much longer.
I hope that's all of it. It, uh, passed through quite a few hands since last night.
Here you go.
Good work. I'll call the medical bay--get them to pick it up ASAP.
You should be proud. You saved a lot of lives today.
Thanks.
Just doing my duty to the Republic and my fellow soldiers.
All in a day's work.
Here's your pay.
You gonna pay me for that?
So... pay?
Oh, don't worry, Command knows how important this medicine is. Here you go.
It was nothing really.
It was easy.
I'm glad to hear it. Still, the Republic's authorized you a reward. I'm supposed to give you this.
Don't know how dangerous it was, but even stepping out your front door can be deadly on Ord Mantell these days.
Good work, and thanks again.
Uh, no, not yet. I'll let you know when I find it, though.
[Lie] Working on it.
Hurry up. The wounded don't have time to spare.
Hurry and get that medicine. Lives depend on it!
Soldier! Soldier!
You're Special Forces, right? I have an urgent mission for you, if you can spare the time.
Sure, bucket-head gets all the glory while I get all the lumps.
I'm important too.
I'm Havoc Squad. What's the mission?
Fill me in.
Oh, you're a civ. Still, I can use all the help I can get, if you're interested in work.
Is there a problem?
I'm always interested in working if you're interested in paying.
We might reach an agreement.
I'm Havoc Squad, Sergeant. What's the problem?
I'm a soldier.
What's in it for me?
You paying?
Republic's authorized hazard pay to anyone who'll help. We got lots of money, but we're short on personnel. How does that sound?
Give me the details.
Sounds like you've just found the person for your mission.
Like a deal.
Glad to hear it. You look like a professional. We need that.
Hazard pay, eh? How dangerous is this mission, exactly?
Sounds dangerous.
You got no business being on Ord Mantell if you're worried about a little danger. Or haven't you noticed there's a war going on?
One of my boys dozed off on guard duty last night. Let the fort's stock of medicine get stolen.
We don't get that medicine back, some good Republic soldiers are gonna leave Ord Mantell in body bags.
Don't worry.
Tough luck.
My men are making sure the separatists don't blow this whole island to tiny pieces. Much as I'd like to, I can't spare them.
Good soldiers are dying without this medicine. So I'll ask you again--you going to let them die, or you going to help?
Okay.
Any idea who took the medicine?
Any suspects?
Sleepyhead claims he woke up as the thief was making her escape. Only saw the back of her, but she looked like a Cathar.
The Cathar are aliens, sort of cat-people that lived nearby. Some were driven out of their homes from the fighting. The refugee camp is a good place to start.
So does this mean you're going to help?
Sure.
This'll be too easy.
I guess I can spare the time.
Oh, all right.
Please hurry. Good soldiers' lives depend on this medicine.
You're on your own.
No way. [Refuse quest]
You don't know what's at stake here. This fort depends on those soldiers.
Don't know how a man could fall asleep on guard duty.
